bug.summary: Cannot run mnist example with gpu
bug.description:
Hello, nni team! I executed mnist tutorial with GPU, but none of the trials launched. (nnictl create --config config_gpu.yml) When I submit an experiment with non-GPU code(config.yml), it worked. Is there any way to solve? Thank you. nni Environment:
nni version: 0.5.1 nni mode(local|pai|remote): local OS: ubuntu 16.04 python version: 3.5 is conda or virtualenv used?: virtualenv is running in docker?:no Tensorflow version: 1.8(with GPU)
nnimanager.log <denchmark-code>[2019-02-21T03:47:48.908Z] INFO [ 'Datastore initialization done' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:48.933Z] INFO [ 'Rest server listening on: http://0.0.0.0:8080' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:48.918Z] INFO [ 'RestServer start' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:48.922Z] INFO [ 'Construct local machine training service.' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:48.926Z] INFO [ 'RestServer base port is 8080' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.191Z] INFO [ 'NNIManager setClusterMetadata, key: trial_config, value: {"gpuNum":1,"command":"python3 mnist.py","codeDir":"/tmp/sungwoo/nni/annotation/tmp4h2ywsv_"}' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.207Z] INFO [ 'required GPU number is 1' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.221Z] INFO [ 'Starting experiment: qx7XLBNw' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.232Z] INFO [ 'Change NNIManager status from: INITIALIZED to: RUNNING' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.235Z] INFO [ 'Add event listeners' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.245Z] INFO [ 'Run local machine training service.' ] [2019-02-21T03:47:51.869Z] ERROR [ 'Read GPU summary failed with error: ', { RangeError [ERR_CHILD_PROCESS_STDIO_MAXBUFFER]: stdout maxBuffer length exceeded at Socket.onChildStdout (child_process.js:343:14) at Socket.emit (events.js:182:13) at addChunk (_stream_readable.js:283:12) at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:260:13) at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:219:10) at Pipe.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:94:17) cmd: 'nvidia-smi -q -x' } ] </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: I have encountered the same problem with you. The remote mode is currently available for normal use.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pigbug419>@pigbug419</denchmark-link>
You are using python virtualenv as your local python interpreter, so it is necessary to clain your python path in your config file. trial: codeDir: . command: /path/to/virtualenv/python3 example.py gpuNum: 1

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pigbug419>@pigbug419</denchmark-link>
I guess that the local mode works successfully but remote mode does not. The timeout error shows that there is something wrong with the network connection between your local machine and your remote cluster. My suggestion: check the network connection between your local machine and your remote cluster. Also, check TCP 8080 port and 8081 port are open.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SparkSnail>@SparkSnail</denchmark-link> had fixed issue in last release, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/QuanluZhang>@QuanluZhang</denchmark-link> to connect the PR here.
the bug "stdout maxBuffer length exceeded" is fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/nni/pull/943>#943</denchmark-link> . This fix has been included in v0.6
